tls:text.tls:line: They wish to protect their six organs

sense.def: BUDDH: the six sense-faculties or sense-organs (this is the standard term; a rarer alternative term is liùqíng 六情; the six sense-faculties consist of yǎngēn 眼根 'eye-organ', ěrgēn 耳根 'ear-organ', bígēn 鼻根 'nose-organ', shégēn 舌根 'taste-organ', shēn'gēn 身根 'touch-organ' and yìgēn 意根 'think-organ'; gēn does not only refer to the physical organ of perception but also to the capality of performing its funtion; the process of perception consists of the liùgēn, interacting with the respective liùjìng 六境 'six sense objects' and liùshí 六識 'six consciousnesses'; see also shíbā jiè 十八界) SANSKRIT ṣaḍ indriyāṇi
